intro: Korthalsella platycaula var. rapensis, commonly known as the Rapens Island bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rapens in the South China Sea. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. It is a rare and endemic species, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
